citations.narrative:
The USDA Annual Report submitted by the research facility for FY 24 was not accurate. The number of Pigs reported
under Column E was 70, however these 70 Pigs should have been reported under Column D.
Per this Section, the annual report shall state the common names and the numbers of animals upon which teaching,
experiments, research, surgery, or tests were conducted involving accompanying pain or distress to the animals and for
which the use of appropriate anesthetic, analgesic, or tranquilizing drugs would have adversely affected the procedures,
results, or interpretation of the teaching, research, experiments, surgery, or tests. The number of animals reported in each
column should be accurate in order to account for the total number of animals used during the Federal fiscal year
reporting period. The research facility corrected this item during the inspection by submitting a corrected FY 24 Annual
Report to USDA. To remain corrected from this date 8/5/25 forward for future USDA annual reports.

Two ferrets were not handled as carefully as possible by animal care technicians during cage change on 2/26/25. The
technician was interrupted after transferring the ferrets to a clean enclosure and as a result of the interruption, they did not
connect the water line to the bank of enclosures. The next morning, husbandry staff discovered that the water line was not
connected; the ferrets were without water for approximately 24 hours. Veterinary staff were notified and the Attending
Veterinarian (AV) immediately evaluated both ferrets. The AV determined that the animals were active, showed no signs
of dehydration, and no treatment was indicated.
Per this Section, the handling of animals by all personnel should be done as carefully as possible in a manner that does
not cause behavioral stress or unnecessary discomfort. The two ferrets were not handled as carefully as possible during
cage transfer when animal care technicians did not connect the water line to their enclosure. As a result of improper
handling, the two ferrets did not have access to water for approximately 24 hours. The research facility addressed this
incident prior to the inspection by modifying the cage change procedure. No additional incidents have occurred. To remain
corrected from this date 8/5/25 forward.
This inspection was conducted with facility representatives 8/4/25 and 8/5/25. The exit briefing was held 8/5/25.
*END OF REPORT*
